Fuction_description: Bifurcates electrons from H2 to heterodisulphide and ferredoxin in methanogens without cytochromes. Probably O2-tolerant
Bidirectionally transport electrons between H2 and NAD depending on redox state. O2-tolerant
Couples oxidation of formate to fermentative evolution of H2. Enzymatic complexes may translocate protons via antiporter modules
Representative_organism: Yersinia enterocolitica subsp. palearctica strain NCTC13769

Fuction_description: Forms respiratory supercomplex that couples oxidation of low-potential carbon compounds to reduction of protons concomitant with Na+ translocation. Electron-input modules include formate dehydrogenases, carbon monoxide dehydrogenases, and potentially glutamate synthases. Electrons flow through hydrogenase resulting in proton reduction to H2. The energy released is used to translocate Na+ ions through Mrp-like antiporter subunits to generate a sodium-motive force.
Organic_cofactors: NuoL, NuoH, NuoC, two [FeS] proteins, seven MRP antiporter subunits, etc.

Fuction_description: Forms complex with carbon monoxide dehydrogenase to anaerobically respire CO using protons as terminal electron acceptors.The released energy is likely used to translocate protons.

Fuction_description:
Forms multimeric complexes that exploit the Na+ motive force to couple H2 oxidation to ferredoxin reduction, in order
to anaplerotically replenish methanogenesis.

Couples ferredoxin oxidation to H2 evolution in acetoclastic methanogens.
This process reversible in hydrogenotrophic methanogens, and is predicted to be coupled to H+
/Na+ translocation.

To confirm. Predict to couple oxidation of formate to proton
reduction and to use the derived energy to translocate protons
To confirm. May form respiratory complex coupling ferredoxin red oxidation to proton reduction. The generated energy is probably involved in traslocating sodium or protons. O2-sensitive

Forms a supercomplex that, utilizing the sodium-motive force, couples H2 oxidation to ferredoxin reduction. The resulting reduced ferredoxin can be utilized anaplerotically to replenish the Wolfe cycle of methanogenesis. While the reverse direction is energetically favorable, it remains uncertain whether it occurs physiologically. O2-sensitive

Forms a supercomplex that, utilizing the sodium-motive force, couples H2 oxidation to ferredoxin reduction. The resulting reduced ferredoxin can be utilized anaplerotically to replenish the Wolfe cycle of methanogenesis. While the reverse direction is energetically favorable, it remains uncertain whether it occurs physiologically. O2-sensitive

or photobiological evolution of H2

to NAD, generating reducing equivalents for
glutamate synthase

ferredoxin and NAD in anaerobic bacteria

Couples formate oxidation to evolution of H2.
Some can also bifurcate electrons from H2 to ferredoxin and NADP

Unknown. May couple oxidation of ferredoxin to fermentative evolution
of H2

Unknown. Predicted to sense H2,
induce cascades and modulate the activity of histidine kinases via redox changes

Unconfirmed role. May serve as H2-sensors in regulatory cascad O2-labilees. Enzyme predicted to transfer H2-liberated electrons to PAS domain. Associated redox change may modulate activity of associated methyl-accepting chemotaxis proteins or diguanylate cyclases in turn leading to regulation of cellular motility
faa:

Fuction_description: Unconfirmed role. May serve as H2-sensors in regulatory cascades. Enzyme predicted to transfer H2-liberated electrons to PAS domain. Associated redox change may modulate activity of associated serine/threonine phosphatase or AAA-type ATPase domains. Members of this class are co-transcribed with fermentative hydrogenases and appear to regulate their transcription. 02-labile

Couples oxidation of H2 to reduction of 5,10-methenyltetrahydrometha-
nopterin in hydrogenotrophic methanogens. The reversible might occur in formatotrophic methanogens
